conclusion: Introduction to the problem and the goal to find maximum induced EMF.
Description of the equilateral triangle properties and orientation.
Explanation of the time frame from point D reaching MN to point C entering the magnetic field.
Introduction to Faraday's law and its application to calculate induced EMF.
Goal to find area A inside the magnetic field as a function of time.
Set up a coordinate system with origin at point D when it reaches MN.
Define positions of points C and D at time t=0 and their movement.
Determine position of vertex E at time t.
Determine time interval from when E crosses x=0 to when C and D cross x=0.
Calculate area inside the magnetic field at time t.
Compute the induced EMF using the rate of change of area.
Verify that the EMF is constant during the interval and determine the maximum EMF.
Determine the final answer for the maximum induced EMF.
